objects.author: Kirkland Crawford
objects.title: Western Michigan stops all athletic team workouts after COVID-19 outbreak
objects.html:
Western Michigan University announced on Thursday that all athletic activities have been paused after nine student athletes tested positive for COVID-19, according to multiple media reports.

According to the Western Herald, the student newspaper in Kalamazoo, WMU has used the surveillence testing for its student athletes recommended by the NCAA. That is to test one quarter to one half of every roster every two weeks for football, volleyball, men's and women's soccer, men's and women's basketball, hockey, baseball, softball and gymnastics.

That testing, according to the Western Herald, began at the start of the fall semester, which was Sept. 2.

The nine positive tests are across four different WMU teams.

The Mid-American Conference, home to WMU, Central Michigan and Eastern Michigan, canceled all fall sports in August. But teams are allowed to continue practicing.

In late July, Michigan State's football team had to quarantine for two weeks after receiving multiple positive test results for COVID-19, days before the Spartans were set to beging their NCAA-allowed two weeks of practices.

As of Wednesday, at least 1,226 current cases of COVID-19 were confirmed on Michigan college campuses.

Contact Kirkland Crawford: kcrawford@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @HiKirkHere.
objects.text:
Western Michigan University announced on Thursday that all athletic activities have been paused after nine student athletes tested positive for COVID-19, according to multiple media reports.
According to the Western Herald, the student newspaper in Kalamazoo, WMU has used the surveillence testing for its student athletes recommended by the NCAA. That is to test one quarter to one half of every roster every two weeks for football, volleyball, men's and women's soccer, men's and women's basketball, hockey, baseball, softball and gymnastics.
That testing, according to the Western Herald, began at the start of the fall semester, which was Sept. 2.
The nine positive tests are across four different WMU teams.
The Mid-American Conference, home to WMU, Central Michigan and Eastern Michigan, canceled all fall sports in August. But teams are allowed to continue practicing.
In late July, Michigan State's football team had to quarantine for two weeks after receiving multiple positive test results for COVID-19, days before the Spartans were set to beging their NCAA-allowed two weeks of practices.
As of Wednesday, at least 1,226 current cases of COVID-19 were confirmed on Michigan college campuses.
